messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-Logic extension introduce to ComfyUI?
The ComfyUI-Logic extension introduces logic nodes and conditional rendering capabilities, such as If, Compare, Int, String, Float, and Bool nodes.
How can I install the ComfyUI-Logic extension?
To install the ComfyUI-Logic extension, clone the repository into the `custom_nodes` folder of ComfyUI and restart ComfyUI.
What features does the ComfyUI-Logic extension provide?
The ComfyUI-Logic extension provides features such as Comparison Nodes, Data Type Nodes, Conditional Execution, and Debugging.
What are the comparison operators supported in the Compare node?
The Compare node supports the comparison operators `a == b`, `a != b`, `a < b`, `a > b`, `a <= b`, `a >= b`.
What nodes are included in the ComfyUI-Logic extension?
The nodes included in the ComfyUI-Logic extension are Compare, Int, String, Float, Bool, and If.
What happens in the If node based on the input?
In the If node, the `IF_TRUE` node is executed if the `ANY` input is True, otherwise, the `IF_FALSE` node is executed.
Who is the author of the ComfyUI-Logic extension?
The author of the ComfyUI-Logic extension is David Fischer.
What information should be included when submitting a feature request for ComfyUI-Logic?

When submitting a feature request for ComfyUI-Logic, include a clear and concise description of the problem, the solution you would like to see implemented, any alternative solutions or features you have considered, and any additional context or screenshots related to the request.
